reviews.text:
not sure if there has been a change in their recipe, but the jamaican beef patties used to be so good but i donâ€™t care for them anymore. this is the 3rd time iâ€™ve visited, got more than one patty and they all have been dry, thin & just not good! bring the good juicy patties back please.

also maybe some indication of where the line starts would help. 2 people were served before me while i was standing there waiting for patties.
Everything was flavorful and fresh but the chicken patty was a highlight. Quick service, friendly staff, and ample seating. 100% recommend!
i had roti chicken wrap  and then again i ordered chowminâ€¦ its so delicious lil oil healthy stuffâ€¦ two guy working there are very energetic, really great atmosphere
So delicious!! Had the Jerk Chicken and it was amazing! I'll definitely be going back.
The food is way over priced. I bought 6 roti, only to find 3 in my bag when I got home. I would not recommend this place.

Everytime i come to Bk, I look forward to coming to Island Express for their bakery items. The restaurant is clean, AC is on and the temperature inside is pleasant. Their staff is always great! I was helped by two gentlemen the other day, one of them resembled the late rapper Nipsey Hussle, which they both were so kind and patient as i always get a lot of bakery items each time I go. The other day I was a little disappointed in the cheese rolls, as they were kinda hard and didn't taste fresh like they normally do, everything else was fine and tasted great!
I also got a peanut punch which was pretty tasty, maybe a little more nutmeg than what I'd prefer, but still was pretty good.

Real guyanese ting here !!! The flavors are incredible and every dish was rich and authentic. The bakery items were so fresh, soft, and full of flavor. The sorrel was especially delicious, perfectly spiced and refreshing. Oh also their prices are reasonable.
Do not eat here! My husband and I just got the worse food poisoning from this place.

Nice space
Great guyanese selection of patties and baked goods
Very clean
Fast service
Good Hot food as well

We had the lunch specials; chicken curry & ox tail stew. We came in at 11:30 and waited till about 12noon when everything was ready. It was worth the wait! The chicken curry was tasty with white & dark meat, some potatoes and chickpeas. I ordered my with roti. The oxtail was also prepared fresh and flavorful. Not too salty. The meat was tender and it came with carrots onions. We would go back again! Thank you Island Express.
TrÃ¨s bonne adresse ! Produits de qualitÃ© ! TrÃ¨s savoureux et prix raisonnable

Delicious lunch special. This fast casual spot caught my eye. Everything looked good to me but I wasnâ€™t sure what to order, so I asked the server to make it like he was eating it. I wound up with BBQ chicken on white rice with chickpeas, and every bite was savory. For <$10, this spot is a great bargain if youâ€™re on the move. The spacious table and clean atmosphere was super welcoming too.
Expect much better from this place food not the best also they did not follow my instructions.

Iâ€™m unsure when but I think they recently changed their containers to a smaller black plastic ones. I usually order the rice & peas with pepper pot. I guess they also changed the menu because I had to get sides? So I chose the plantain & okra, they barely had plantains, was embarrassing so I told him itâ€™s fine, no plantains & then he put back rice from my bowl back into the pot to make room for the pepper pot, I was so disgusted & annoyed I had to walk out. Iâ€™ll try again next time.
I got curry chicken (wished the chicken had more flavor) and white rice (the rice sucked) - and I wouldnâ€™t recommend this place.

This is the best Caribbean restaurant that I visit on a regular.This family business is very customer oriented and values customer satisfaction as their #1 priority.I live in Harlem NYC and whenever I call and order dishes,I can requestâ€¦

I ordered delivery of Jamaican beef pattie in cocoa bread, and received stale, hard butterflap in place of the cocoa bread. When I called to complain, the man who took the call was very rude. He told me that it was a Guyanese restaurant,â€¦
Tasty

Absolutely love this place!  Food is excellent and the establishment is super clean.  Food is always fresh and very kind staff.  I was shocked at how inexpensive the pricing is.  This will be my new go to spot for when Iâ€™m in the area.

Something seemed off about the guys vibe who handled my food because he had a â€œI donâ€™t care â€œ, type of attitude. I just threw up after eating their food
it never happened before . I had food poisoning from them. ðŸ‘ŽðŸ¾ Probably selling expired food or he didnâ€™t like me or something.
I travel from Long Island to get my goodies from Island Express... I absolutely love the cheese rolls. Everything is delicious. Authentic Guyanese food!!!
Food is delicious. 10/10 highly recommend.
Great tasting Guyanese cuisine! â¤ï¸

first time i went some where and vegetable patty was filled with different vegetables (mushroom, beans, peppers, etc )

walked in to drop some flyers pine comb tax got a veggy patty
walking and eating i taste it so i had to look in  as i see all the diff veggies i double back for another
taste was good, but really not a lot of meat with the goat curry. spices all good, and i expect bones, but was 50 percent huge bones and barely any meat...
Fantastic service, exceptional food, wonderful atmosphere
Great place!
Outstanding Service with quality entries.

The chicken roti is definitely not a roti. When I ordered it, I didn't expect to get curry chicken and exactly 3 pieces of potatoes. Not a chick pea in sight.
Plus in my mind I am thinking a dhalpuri roti, not some flatbread. Definitely not worth the price.
Also the veggie roti same thing, shouldn't there be an option to choose sides like potato, bhagi, pumpkin etc. Instead I get a bowl of cabbage soup mix. Unacceptable. Please do better and do not misrepresent.
Great curry itâ€™s amazing!!! Fish cakes were out of this world I am in Love with the food here! Highly recommend!
I sometimes go here for the roti which is good. I tried the pepperpot for the first time from here recently and I could not finish it at all. The taste was not pleasing in the slightest.
All is good ðŸ˜Š
Food is great service needs work
Very clean, there is never a line, friendly and happy employees, a comprehensive menu, and delicious food at a reasonable price.

Went on my many adventures in search of good food, I havenâ€™t been to this area of Brooklyn in years, itâ€™s great to know this  authentic Guyanese culture is here making a stamp on the food nation. Itâ€™s was my first time going to this restaurant, the jerk chicken was absolutely amazing. I definitely will be returning to experience more of the menu.

I'm not sure how Guyanese oxtails are supposed to taste. I think this is my 1st time eating from a Guyanese spot. And it was decent. I would be interested in trying something else from here. My meal didn't pop with flavor for a Caribbean dish

As a chef I never eat outside. Only if my friends make food. Yesterday we visited this place with a group. Since I was very hungry I made a simple order of rice & peas and beef carry. It was very balanced and moderately spiced. Last month my Caribbean friends cooked an incredible lunch for us. The taste was identical to island express.
The beef patties are good. Try the peanut punch drink.

I was very disappointed! I'm a foodie, and I love me some guyanese baked goods. I went here with my friend and was not impressed with the way I was treated. The first impression of the place was positive but when you are dealt with the staff especially if you are LGBT,  you would not get a good experience.  This place seem to only cater to good looking women and not people as a whole. The lack of customer service is seen especially in the younger male workers who you can tell have something against thr LGBT community, it's very serious especially being that we live in 2024. Now to actually rate the item I got! It was horrible, it give guyanese bread a bad name. I ordered the butter bread and it was the most stale piece of bread I ever tasted. Please do not think this is how Guyanese bread taste, this place is giving it a bad name. They really need to study their recipes.  If you want some good Guyanese Bread, please go to Bakewell, then you can make your opinion on Guyanese Bread. Overall, I was totally disappointed in thr way i was treated and the way the bread was stale. Never giving my business here again.

UPDATE: Toasting bread with some butter makes it a little better so my advice is to toast it before eating it.

It pains me to write the following somewhat negative review. I've been a fan of Island Express for a while. The food is close to "authentic Guyanese auntie" cooking and is one of the best Caribbean casual restaurants in Brooklyn.

However, the recent (shrinkflation) reduction in portion sizes has significantly decreased the value of ordering from this otherwise great establishment. ðŸ˜”

Had this for the first time today and it was so so good! I got a bowl with the rice & peas, curry chicken, okra, and channa. The okra was a little tough in some parts but otherwise everything was excellent. Really great flavors that come together well. I also got a cocktail beef patty and guava tart which were also excellent. Will definitely be coming back!
Delicious Guyanese food for a great price. The same workers have been there for a while; they are friendly and remember customers, which always makes me feel welcome. Highly recommend!

The bakery is ok. BUT, this is the first time I've ever had food from a Caribbean restaurant and had to throw it away. Us island people take great pride in our dishes. However, each bite made me want to literally vomit. The pepper pot was disgusting, poorly seasoned. The okra was tough in some spots. The tamarind sauce was rancid. This place is like the school cafeteria version of Caribbean food. What an unfortunate and highly disappointing waste of money, time and taste buds.
Whenever I need a taste of home, this is my go to. I havenâ€™t been disappointed yet.

This is no frills fast casual dining with a very clean inside and a decent amount of seating. The service is quick. They run out of their plantains so be ready with a back up for side options. The prices to portions are great, I paid $15 for oxtail and $11 for goat curry. One dish is definitely enough to fill you up. The only thing I'd change is I wish the oxtail leaned in to the taste of the beef more with a stronger, more savory flavor instead of cinnamony sweet. I also wish the guava tarts had more filling and were softer.

My friend and I got the $6 lunch special, beef patties, and sorel! Curry chicken and peas & rice was delicious! Love the Fried plantain too, not over fried. Everything was flavorful and fresh! Worth every penny. Will definitely be back!

This place is a complete joke. I ordered chicken curry, spinach, veggies chow mein, and tamarind from UberEats. The curry had absolutely noooo taste! I requested pepper and nothing came with it. At least if I had some pepper it would have gave the food a likkle flavor. The spinach was full of oil; just drenched. And the tamarind was sour skunt. The chow mein in mek it. I spent $41 for exactly what?! I will be disputing with Uber. Definitely will not be ordering again from this establishment.

Everything we ordered was delicious! We had the oxtail, fried fish, plantains, chicken roti, and beef patty. I could eat multiple beef patties -- the crust is so flaky. Plus, they had our order ready much faster than estimated through Seamless. Can't wait to try other items on their menu.
So very delicious! The staff is beyond friendly. Truly loved it all. I got the chicken curry with rice and peas. Yum!!!!!!! Highly recommend.

Wonderful and inviting place to eat.  Amazing customer service only exceeded by the  mouth watering menu.  Great modern update of Sybils a family owned store that  relocated and rebranded itself with a fresh new look and attitude.

The menu explains what all of the tasty items are and there is a separate line for both hot prepared foods & baked goods. This is a rarity in NYC establishments and makes service speedy and efficient.  Island Express is a 1st class place to dine!
Rich and rendered oxtail and tasty fried fish. The hot sauce is peppery and very strong.

While your at Flatbush come stop at island express for some GREAT authentic Guyanese food. My wife and I had some fish balls Guyanese chicken Pattieâ€™s guava tarts and black eye cake! Hands down the best place next to liberty ave!!
Food was ok the only problem was the rice had no salt  which  didnâ€™t compliment the curry other than that customer service was good And be aware they raised their price!
I had the Rice & Peas, Jerk Chicken, spinach, and beef patty.  It was very good!

I was so excited to try this restaurant out given its many positive reviews. Unfortunately my experience was not a positive one and I will breakdown the rationale below:

Jerk chicken lunch special - This meal came in a small white container, one that usually holds dumplings to give you a perspective. Nonetheless, if the food was good, I would not have mind the small portion. The jerk chicken was by far the DRIEST jerk chicken I ever had. Not only were all the chicken white meat, which is fine, but it was extremely overcooked and rubbery. The best part of this lunch special was the plantains, which was cooked perfectly, soft and sweet. But unfortunately, the jerk chicken was not delicious at all...=/

Chicken stew with spinach and roti - You would think that a chicken stew would be moist, juicy, or at least tender. However, despite the sauce from the stew, the chicken was still incredibly dry. I was really looking forward to this dish for it sounded so delicious and heartwarming. Unfortunately, that was not my experience at all. Really wanted this first time experience to be amazing...

Overall, the best part was probably the delivery person, who was nice and kind. If you do decide to give them a try, please try their other options because I'm sure they have some other more delicious selections! Just try to stay away from these two.

Thank you for reading and good luck!

Those 2 Guys at the front serving have great Customer Service. Omg. Love them. What made me felt special was when I went back there 3 days later, they remembered me.  Nice and tasty foods. I ordered Guyanese style Chicken Patties, Butter Flap, Pine Tarts, Chowmein and Cook up Rice with chicken.  Now I'm dribbling...lol

Nice in and out Guyanese restaurant in the heart of Flatbush Avenue. While the food looks good , I mostly go there for their baked goods. I love, love, love their Guyanese cocktail beef patties. They are always hot, fresh and juicy! Myâ€¦
